definition: to bank up with earth/to cultivate (lit. or fig.)/to train (people)
to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate

sentences.english: How to develop the economy of tax fund is a new problem now.
sentences.chinese: 如何培育地方税源经济是当前的新课题。

sentences.english: Rice, cotton and vegetable seeds are sometimes grown in special seedbeds.
sentences.chinese: 有时，大米，棉花和蔬菜种子要在苗床培育。

sentences.english: Humus soil is the best culture substrate for Chinese pine.
sentences.chinese: 腐殖质土是培育油松苗的很好基质。

sentences.english: The new variety of netted melon Ruilong is bred by a hybrid and an inbred line.
sentences.chinese: 应用三交种育种技术培育出网纹甜瓜新品种“瑞龙”。

sentences.english: They have also bred 200,000 toxin-free fruit tree nurseries.
sentences.chinese: 他们还培育无毒果树苗木二十万株。

sentences.english: The cultivation of the intermediary of Qingdao should do a good job in the three major impetuses.
sentences.chinese: 青岛市中介组织的培育应该抓好三大著力点。

sentences.english: The horticulturist developed a new type of rose.
sentences.chinese: 园艺师培育了玫瑰的一个新品种。

sentences.english: Encourage their children to learn to make progress, to foster a positive attitude towards life of children.
sentences.chinese: 鼓舞孩子好学上进，培育孩子积极的生活态度。

sentences.english: Intrigued, Mr. Wohlleben began investigating alternate approaches to forestry.
sentences.chinese: 沃莱本受到吸引，开始调查培育林木的其他方法。

sentences.english: It's important that breeding the resistant variety to prevent the diseases.
sentences.chinese: 防治该病的主要措施是培育抗病品种。

sentences.english: So the research of cultivars resistance were received more and more closed attention.
sentences.chinese: 因此，寻找和培育持久抗病品种成为研究的热点。

sentences.english: We will promote the development of high-tech  industrial clusters and cultivate new economic growth areas.
sentences.chinese: 推动发展高新技术产业群，培育新的经济增长点。

sentences.english: Foster an enterprise culture of safety and security.
sentences.chinese: 培育一个安全和可靠的企业文化。

sentences.english: The theory of education probed into how to develop ideal personality.
sentences.chinese: 教育论则是探讨怎样培育理想人格。

sentences.english: Nothing good ever comes of violence.
sentences.chinese: 暴力无法培育出任何善果。

sentences.english: students attend a boarding school would cultivate their independence as apart from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 分开怙恃上寄宿黉舍的学生将会培育他们的自力性。

definition: to cultivate/to breed/to foster/to nurture/to educate/to groom (for a position)/education/fostering/culture (biology)
breeding/to incubate/innovation (esp. in commerce and marketing)
to take in/to absorb/to admit/to accept
to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
to grow/to cultivate/to train/to educate/to patronize
to graft (a branch to a rootstock)
